column5: Going to GB for the weekend and was wondering where to get good sized "fall walleye" live minnows along my route.  The Bait Bucket in Barrie only has small/medium.  Thanks in advance!

give true canadian outdoors a ring in vaughan.  We were able to get "whales" and various sized baits at a decent price.  905-761-9666  guys a good guy and even agreed to carry a few of my buddies hand tied flies and jigs.  Cant tell you what hes currently carrying right now but been solid in the past.
Natural sports in Kitchener usually has large minnows
I second Natural Sports if its large walleye bait  you want. You want musky bait? Different story...use the walleye you catch
I second Natural Sports if its large walleye bait  you want. You want musky bait? Different story...use the walleye you catch Def. use the perch I catch..lol

give true canadian outdoors a ring in vaughan.  We were able to get "whales" and various sized baits at a decent price.  905-761-9666  guys a good guy and even agreed to carry a few of my buddies hand tied flies and jigs.  Cant tell you what hes currently carrying right now but been solid in the past. Thanks!  I'll check them out.
There is All Nation tackle, and the Toronto Outdoor Store about a block away from one another at 401 and 400.  Both usually have large minnows - if the other places don't pan out.
Def. use the perch I catch..lol  FYI this is illegal...  I personally think its stupid as long as its within your limits...but heads up you can only use live bait listed on the bait list.
